keyFactors.title: NBA's Second-Leading Scorer
keyFactors.description: Averaging 33.2 PPG (2nd in NBA) with 8.2 APG. Combined 41.4 P+A made 37.5 line appear undervalued.

keyFactors.title: Historic Sixers Performance
keyFactors.description: Joined Allen Iverson as only Sixers to record 25+ pts, 5+ ast in first 10 games. Elite two-way production.

keyFactors.title: No Joel Embiid (Knee Soreness)
keyFactors.description: Embiid sidelined meant Maxey was undisputed first option with higher usage expected.

keyFactors.title: Previous Meeting Success
keyFactors.description: Dropped 40 points vs Boston on opening night (October 22). Established scoring blueprint against this defense.

keyFactors.title: Elite Recent Form
keyFactors.description: Coming off 40 P+A performance just 2 days prior. Red-hot stretch with consistent production.

riskFactors: Third meeting in three weeks with Boston (defensive familiarity)
Celtics could adjust gameplan after previous two games
Road divisional opponent increases defensive intensity

quarterBreakdown.description: Maxey struggled to find rhythm early, shot poorly (5-17 overall). Boston's defensive gameplan specifically targeted him after two previous meetings.
Continued shooting struggles, accumulated assists but couldn't score efficiently. Game remained competitive.
Justin Edwards took over (22 pts, 8-9 FG, three consecutive threes). Edwards' breakout stole touches from Maxey. 76ers won 102-100 on Oubre putback.

gameResults.whenMissed: By late Q3, Maxey's poor shooting (5-17) and Edwards' hot hand made OVER increasingly unlikely.
gameResults.gamePace: Low-scoring defensive grind (202 total points). Created fewer possessions than usual high-paced Maxey games.
gameResults.gameScript: Justin Edwards scored team-high 22 points on 8-9 shooting (88.9%), including three consecutive 4th quarter threes. His usage diverted possessions from Maxey.

whatWentWrong.title: Career-Worst Shooting Night (PRIMARY FACTOR)
whatWentWrong.description: 5-17 FG (29.4%) was massive departure from recent efficiency. Couldn't find rhythm despite getting to free throw line (8-8 FT).

whatWentWrong.title: Justin Edwards' Breakout Stole Touches
whatWentWrong.description: Edwards scored team-high 22 points on 8-9 shooting (88.9%), including three consecutive 4th quarter threes that brought Sixers back from 8-point deficit. His usage diverted possessions from Maxey.

whatWentWrong.title: Celtics' Defensive Gameplan
whatWentWrong.description: Third meeting in three weeks allowed Boston to specifically scheme for Maxey after he dropped 40 opening night and 26 on Halloween. Defensive familiarity killed efficiency.

whatWentWrong.title: Low-Scoring Defensive Grind
whatWentWrong.description: Final score 102-100 (only 202 total points) created fewer possessions than usual. Low-scoring environment limited opportunities.

whatWentWrong.title: Other Players Stepped Up
whatWentWrong.description: Edwards (22), Grimes (18), Drummond (14-13) all contributed, reducing Maxey's burden and usage.

statisticalContext.historicalContext: Second-lowest P+A total of season after incredible 10-game run

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: Yes, this was shooting variance meeting defensive familiarity. Even elite scorers have 5-17 nights. Third meeting in three weeks gave Boston blueprint to slow Maxey. Single-game variance is unavoidable—8 of 9 previous games hit the line, one cold night doesn't invalidate analysis.

closingLineValue.verdict: Slight positive CLV (5-7 cents). Got slightly better odds than closing market.

keyTakeaways: Divisional opponents provide defensive familiarity: Third meeting in three weeks gave Boston blueprint to slow Maxey
Shooting variance kills player props: Even elite scorers have 5-17 nights; single-game variance is unavoidable
Game flow matters more than individual talent: Edwards' breakout (22 pts, 8-9 FG) diverted offense
Low-scoring games reduce prop opportunities: 202 total points created fewer possessions than normal
Not all losses indicate bad process: 8 of 9 previous games hit; one cold night doesn't invalidate analysis
Zero turnovers shows excellent decision-making despite poor shooting
Team still won (102-100) despite Maxey's struggles—shows depth
verdict: Sound analysis met statistical variance. Sometimes good bets lose. Grade: B
